html: Today the internet is 50 years old. The internet & the web it enabled have changed billions of lives for the better. But their power for good is under threat. This birthday must mark the moment we take on the fight for the web we want. https://webfoundation.org/2019/10/as-the-internet-turns-50-we-must-protect-it-as-a-force-for-good/ … #Internet50
text:
Today the internet is 50 years old.

The internet & the web it enabled have changed billions of lives for the better. But their power for good is under threat.

This birthday must mark the moment we take on the fight for the web we want.

https://webfoundation.org/2019/10/as-the-internet-turns-50-we-must-protect-it-as-a-force-for-good/ …
#Internet50

html: Quando você foca nas suas próprias conquistas e não se compara, você não tem tempo para se sentir mal. É lindo. Se comparar com quem você era há 6 meses atrás e não com o outro, que possui outra história - que nunca poderá ser sua métrica, pois cada um tem a sua própria.
text:
Quando você foca nas suas próprias conquistas e não se compara, você não tem tempo para se sentir mal.

html: I don't want to alienate any Vue users who feel "not getting it" for now - what I do ask of you is to keep an open mind and spend some time reading through the RFC in its entirety, and as much of the discussion as possible. Many have changed their minds after doing so.

In #JavaScript arrays are not true arrays. So you can't simply do a "typeof" check. But not a problem! With #ES6, finally there is an easier way to check if a value is an actual array. Use “Array.isArray()”

html: Confession: today I fixed a bug in what was poorly design code. But I was in a hurry and didn't have time to refactor it so instead I doubled-down on the anti-pattern and figured out a devious way around it. Isn't that just the dirtiest feeling?
